revised_title: Anatomical Study of a Species of Asteroid Polyps
tldr: The author describes the anatomy of a species of asteroid polyps, likely belonging to a new genus of Alcyonidae. The polypidom has a branched structure with irregular dichotomous branching, and its internal substance consists of longitudinal muscular septa connected by vessels. The polyp-cells have a cup-like shape with eight oral tentacula and are supported by spicula.
